intro: Andreettaea xanthella, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. Andreettaea xanthella is often found in coastal dunes and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
